title: 'Victorian' style type
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4392.jpg)

Hi,

I’m trying to find a font that resembles the above image. Can anyone help?

Thanks.

 [‹ (x) "Om Shanti Om" psychedelic display sans - Oliver {Faiyaz Kolia (self)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854/http:/typophile.com/node/40452 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Minimöbl Montage-anleitungen monospaced tech sans - Grinder Gothic {Marten F} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854/http:/typophile.com/node/39439 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Jim_t

comments.content:
You might like Sackers Light Roman:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-light-classic-roman/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-light-classic-roman/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/sackers-light-classic-roman/")

This type looks very familiar, but I can not locate it at the moment. [LHF Citizen](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/citizen.shtml) is one of a few classic Roman styles at Letterhead Fonts that are based on this kind of serif.

- Mike Yanega

This one has kept bugging me, so I have continued hunting. I found Nick Curtis’ version of an old ATF type called ’Tabard’. OldNick calls it [Gandy Dancer](http://web.archive.org/web/20080105013854/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/gandy-dancer-nf/). It is a more narrow face than your sample, but un-squooshing™ could fix that.

- Mike Yanega
